intro: Cleisostoma parvum, commonly known as the small-flowered cleisostoma, is a species of flowering plant in the family Orchidaceae. It is native to Southeast Asia, particularly found in countries like Thailand, Vietnam, and Indonesia. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers that are typically yellow or greenish-yellow in color. It thrives in shaded, humid environments and is often found growing on tree trunks or rocks. Due to its delicate appearance and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and valuable species in botanical collections.
